summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview conducted on August 14, 2019, with a Bureau of Prisons employee regarding a review of Jeffrey Epstein's inmate records and activity at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following his death. It details anomalies in his phone records, including an unrecorded call placed on an unsecure line the day before his death, and provides information about his commissary funds, next of kin notification, and last cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose records are being reviewed. The document details his phone activity, commissary funds, and last cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's next of kin, who was notified by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) supervisor at 1100 hours on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate at the MCC, who was released from court on August 9, 2019. His date of birth is listed as 03/10/1969.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is listed as Jeffrey Epstein's next of kin, whom the BOP supervisor notified of his death.
Efrain Reyes was Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate at the MCC before being released on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Unrecorded Phone Call
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein placed a phone call on an unsecure 'legal line' which is not recorded. He reportedly told BOP staff there was an issue with his phone account, preventing a normal call. The call was made at approximately 1900 hours to an unspecified number, with Epstein indicating he was calling his deceased mother.

events.title: BOP Notification to Next of Kin
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons (BOP) supervisor notified Jeffrey Epstein's next of kin, Mark Epstein, of his death at 1100 hours.

events.title: Release of Cellmate Efrain Reyes
events.description: Efrain Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate, was released from court.

events.title: FBI Interview Regarding Epstein's Records
events.description: The reporting FBI investigator met with a BOP employee to review Jeffrey Epstein's inmate records and activity following his death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein placed an unrecorded phone call on an unsecure 'legal line' at approximately 1900 hours on August 9, 2019, the day before his death, claiming he was calling his deceased mother due to a phone account issue.
Epstein had no recorded phone calls in the standard database, which an employee found odd, and he had no 'authorized persons' or anyone listed on his call log.
Epstein's commissary account held $566.27 at the time of his death, and he had no recorded visitors to the MCC.
Epstein's last cellmate was Efrain Reyes (DOB 03/10/1969), who was released from court on August 9, 2019.
A BOP supervisor notified Epstein's next of kin, Mark Epstein, of his death at 1100 hours on August 10, 2019.
